intro: Eurycoma harmandiana, commonly known as the Malayan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. It has a taproot system and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Eurycoma harmandiana is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
